title: The Chef at Home
features: Ever watch Top Chef, Iron Chef or any number of competition shows? When these Chefs run around a kitchen creating these incredible meals from next to nothing and wonder…what does this guy cook at home? Does his family eat that good?It’s been said that the crappiest running car in town belongs to the mechanics wife. Granted, Chef Johns family does eat their share of delivered pizzas and Chinese takeout. He does try to cook a great meal at home at least once a week, more often depending on work schedules. Never having made Duck Confit or Fois Gras for the family (they probably wouldn’t eat it anyway), but they do eat pretty well. Here are Chef Johns original recipes and family favorites. This is How the Chef at Home cooks.
description: Chef John's love of both cooking and writing began at a very young age. Always a writer of short stories and articles, He spent time in the military and pursued a career as a civilian in the medical profession. After 22 years of working in and around hospitals, John decided to follow his passion for food into a career and attended the International Culinary School at The Art Institute of Las Vegas earning an Associates of Science in Culinary Arts. Today, John lives in Las Vegas, Nevada with his wife and writes various articles for publication on the Internet. He is also a member and Certified Barbeque Judge of the Kansas City BBQ Society.

After 22 years of working in and around hospitals, John decided to follow his passion for food into a career and attended the International Culinary School at The Art Institute of Las Vegas earning an Associates of Science in Culinary Arts, sharpening his skills in the 4 and 5 star resort casinos of Las Vegas. In 2015 Chef John placed 7th in the World Food Championships Blogger Challenge. In 2016 He won the "Just a pinch" Seafood competition which qualified him for the one of 50 spots in the World Food Championships seafood category. In 2017 Chef John again qualified for World Food Championships by winning the Taste of America Competition, Texas.
